prompt: Determine whether M_67 = 2^67 - 1 is prime or composite. If composite, give complete prime factorization.

initial_analysis: 2^67-1 is a large integer: about 20 digits
Mersenne numbers M_p for prime exponent p are sometimes prime
Exponent 67 is not in the known list - thus 2^67 - 1 is composite
number_theory_knowledge: If p is a prime divisor of 2^n - 1 then order of 2 modulo p divides n
For Mersenne numbers where exponent p is prime, any divisor q must be congruent to 1 mod 2p
Any prime divisor q must be of form 2kp+1 and q = 1 (mod 8)
For p=67: any divisor must be of form 134k+1
model_reasoning.verification_attempt: Tried to compute 2^67 mod 269 to check if order is exactly 67

code_executed.note: Model correctly used bit shift for efficiency

analysis.reasoning_chain: EXCELLENT - derived candidate primes from first principles
